result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State has sent all discovery and an offer to resolve case.  Defense has discussed with State about defendant enrolling into Wellness Court which State is open to.  Bond continued.

records.addlTxt: Defendant does not appear. Attornery Jolin appears in court for the Defendant.  DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court will issues $500.00 bench warrant if the Defendant does not appears unless Attorney Jolin can get a hold of her client.

Maintain absolute sobriety, not to possess controlled substances and only take medications as prescribed.
22-000130

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause. Court sets $2500.00 signature bond. Conditions,   Maintain absolute sobriety, not to possess controlled substances and only take medications as prescribed. Court adjourns initial appearance to February 14th at 10:00 am. Defendant must appear in person unless approved by the court otherwise.
